text: Stone type, color, and dimensions as per approved shop drawings/submittals
Stones stored on pallets or racks and protected from staining or chipping
Anchors, ties, and fasteners approved and corrosion-resistant
Backup wall/substrate inspected and approved (CMU, concrete, sheathing)
Flashing and waterproofing membrane installed at base and openings
Ventilation weeps or vents installed per spec
Lath (if used) installed with proper spacing and fasteners
Mortar type and mix verified per specification
Stones laid per pattern and coursing details
Each stone securely anchored with specified anchors/ties
Minimum joint spacing and bedding thickness maintained
Cavity kept clean and unobstructed (no mortar droppings)
Joints tooled to match specified profile (raked, concave, etc.)
Surface cleaned using approved method (no acid or abrasive if not allowed)
All loose material and stains removed from face
QA/QC and consultant final review completed
